availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City and County of New York } SS:

Alexander Ostrander of said City being duly sworn says that as a Commissioner of Deeds, appointed under Chapter 70 of the Act of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky entitled "An act to adopt the Revised Statutes" approved January 7th 1852, for the said State of Kentucky, residing in said City of New York -- he will perform the duties of said Office faithfully, to the best of his ability and in accordance with the Constitution and laws of the United States and of the said Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 21 day of September A.D. 1864

Samuel Brown
Notary Public
Sept 21 1864
S. B.

Impression of my official seal
Alex. Ostrander
Commissioner for Kentucky in New York

Comr Deeds
New York
Oath of
Alex Ostrander
filed
26th Nov/64
